question.direction-text: Select the appropriate sentences from the answer choices that are key points in a discussion of how well various publishers succeeded in creating adless newspapers. This question is worth 3 points.

intro-text.b: How well various publishers succeeded in creating adless newspapers

answer.answer-text: Scripps managed to establish two newspapers without ads, though neither endured.
answer.explain-text: The passage states that Scripps' adless paper in Chicago was the Chicago Day Book, that it was actually profitable for only one month, and that publication of the Chicago Day Book was stopped in 1917. The passage goes on to state that he opened a second adless paper, the Philadelphia News-Post and that this paper was operated without any advertising for a two-year period from 1912 to 1914 before losses forced its closing. From this, it can be determined that Scripps managed to establish two newspapers without ads, though neither endured. This answer provides critical information to support the topic of how well various publishers succeeded in creating adless newspapers and is therefore one of the correct answers to this question.

answer.answer-text: Dana managed to meet his objective of eliminating advertising from the New York Sun, though only for a short period of time.
answer.explain-text: The passage mentions Dana and states that he made the elimination of advertising from the New York Sun a primary objective and that he was unable to achieve the goal of publishing a newspaper without any reliance on advertising. This means that it is NOT true that Dana managed to meet his objective of eliminating advertising from the New York Sun, though only for a short period of time. This answer is therefore not a correct answer to this question.

answer.answer-text: Ingersoll created an adless paper that was initially immensely successful but then tumbled.
answer.explain-text: The passage mentions Ingersoll and states that he hoped to create a high-quality paper…unencumbered with advertising, that first-day sales were an incredible 450,000 copies, and that within three months, the paper had lost so much money that Ingersoll and his investors were forced to sell out. This means that Ingersoll created an adless paper that was initially immensely successful but then tumbled. This answer provides critical information to support the topic of how well various publishers succeeded in creating adless newspapers and is therefore one of the correct answers to this question.

answer-text.exp: Scripps proved quite successful in creating a business empire based on the penny press.

answer.explain-text: The passage states that Scripps had first achieved success in publishing by creating an empire in the penny press. This means that it is true that Scripps proved quite successful in creating a business empire based on the penny press. However, even though this is true, it is not a critical point in supporting the topic of how well various publishers succeeded in creating adless newspapers. This answer is therefore not a correct answer to this question.

answer-text.exp: Dana managed to reduce, but not eliminate, the role of advertising in the newspaper that he owned.

answer.explain-text: The passage mentions Dana and states that he did reduce the paper's dependence on advertising and relegated the wishes of advertisers to a secondary position behind the news. This means that Dana managed to reduce, but not eliminate, the role of advertising in the newspaper that he owned. This answer provides critical information to support the topic of how well various publishers succeeded in creating adless newspapers and is therefore one of the correct answers to this question.

answer-text.exp: Scripps managed to keep an adless paper going in New York City for a short period of time.

answer.explain-text: The passage mentions Scripps and states that he began planning his opening venture in New York City; however, his plans for an adless paper in New York City fell apart before the first paper was printed. This means that it is NOT true that Scripps managed to keep an adless paper going in New York City for a short period of time. This answer is therefore not a correct answer to this question.
